Description: Fragment of pottery Rhodian transport amphora handle; flattened handle, clay near fine pink-buff with white slip. Lip, neck and handle, gradual curve. Circular stamp; cornucopia symbol.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, From the Libyan desert.
Curator's comments: Name Aristeidas. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 379.04.
